pr_title: feat: trace up only one level when calculating parent types with singleton resource names

timeline.bodyText: Is this method ever called for a pattern of ""? If so, it should return "" at that point.
timeline.author: jskeet
jskeet

timeline.bodyText:
I suspect this should be index >= 0 - as otherwise we get an empty pattern, which still isn't a useful parent.
(Basically, taking the parent of "foo" for "foos/{foo}" is invalid, I'd say. The empty pattern can't represent a resource name, so it's not useful.)
timeline.author: jskeet

replies.bodyText: That is correct from the public-facing point of view - but this is an internal method. We need to call this method on every resource pattern to find if it has a parent, if so, which resource does the parent belong to. Therefore we can't error if the calculated parent is empty (for instance projects/{project}). I guess we are sort of using an empty string as a way to express "this pattern does not have a parent pattern".
replies.author: yihanzhen

replies.bodyText: Ah, okay - in C# I believe we only find parents when we're asked to :)
replies.author: jskeet

replies.bodyText: Hi Jon, can you approve the PR if you don't think there are other issues?
replies.author: yihanzhen

replies.bodyText: There's still the matter of the parent - of "*" - which wasn't clear in my previous comment due to Markdown, unfortunately. Basically I'd like to see a test showing that if you pass in "*", you get "*" back - and code to make that work.
replies.author: jskeet

replies.bodyText: Oh that solves all the puzzles now. I will fix "*" shortly.
replies.author: yihanzhen
